text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with mocha semifreddo that's right
every year about this time I get tons of
requests for how to make ice cream
without a machine to which I usually
respond you can't buy a machine but
during some recent experiments with
semifreddo recipes I realized that this
light but still decadent frozen Italian
dessert was the answer to that question
plus I have more good news we're going
to do all this with a very streamlined
simplified procedure so let's go ahead
and get started by throwing a couple
eggs in a bowl now normally these eggs
will be separated and we'd use the yolks
to make a zabaione and the whites to
make a meringue but we're going to
combine those two things into one step
that I'll call the zapper rang and
believe me nobody was more shocked than
I was when this actually worked and then
to the eggs we'll add a little bit of
instant coffee and by the way you only
need a teaspoon or two so don't buy a
whole jar just borrow some from your
neighbor and then we're also going to
need some white sugar as well as a
little splash of your favorite coffee
liqueur I know you want to save it for
your White Russians but you can spare a
little splash dude and then because
we're calling this mocha we need a
little bit of cocoa and then last but
not least a little pinch of salt and
what we want to do is take a whisk and
mix this well before we take it to the
stove and cook it over a double boiler
until it's hot and thick except you know
what we're not going to use a double
boiler we're going to do this directly
over a low flame ensure this might seem
a little dangerous and it's perfectly
normal to be half scared which I believe
in Italian is semi afraid Oh a lot don't
worry this is going to work just keep
your heat down low make sure you
continue to whisk and by the way I
thought you could see it in the frame
but you can't but I do have a very firm
grip on this bowl with a towel because
obviously this bowl is going to get hot
and one huge pro tip don't let the towel
catch on fire especially if you're
litigious and would blame me for that so
please be careful and like I said we're
going to cook this pretty much whiskey
and continually until those eggs cook
through in the mixture thickens up and
this is going to take a few minutes and
I realize not everyone's arms are as
freakishly strong as mine are so if your
arm gets tired and you need a break no
problem just remove the bowl from the
heat until your arm and our wrist
recovers and then put it back over the
heat and continue to whisk and cook and
of course if you have an electric mixer
you can use that here and as you do this
you'll note
it will get thicker and foam ear and
towards the end you may even see a
whisper - of steam and we want to keep
whisking and cooking until eventually we
have something that looks like this
which some people would refer to as the
ribbon stage because those ribbons a
mixture dripping off the whisk sort of
stay on the surface for a second or two
and what happens if you go too far in
the egg scramble no problem just start
over so at this point we will remove
that from the heat and cool it down
completely and what I like to do is just
pop that on top of a bowl of ice water
or in my case is to blow very cold water
and once that mixture has cooled down we
can move on to the final step which is
the whipped cream so we're going to add
some ice cold heavy cream to an already
cold Bowl yes keep the bowl and the
cream in the fridge it will definitely
whip up faster and easier and we want to
whip this cream into fairly stiff peaks
and the only thing we're going to add to
this is a little bit of sugar and
ideally we would add the sugar right
here when we just start to get nice soft
peaks but to be honest I forgot for a
couple seconds so I actually didn't add
my sugar until this point but the good
news is it still worked so we'll add a
spoon of sugar and we'll continue
whisking until like I said we have
fairly stiff peaks okay you see those
nice sharp lines that's what we're
looking for and be careful don't go any
farther than this otherwise you're going
to make butter and once our whipped
cream is set we are ready to combine our
two components so by now our egg mixture
is fully cooled and for some reason I
decided to give it a mix sometimes it's
just fun to stir something but anyway
what we're going to do to finish this
off is to add our egg and coffee mixture
to the whipped cream and then we'll take
a spatula and stir this together until
it's just combined and you'll notice I
didn't say fold this mixture just isn't
going to be thick and airy enough for
your classic folding technique but as
you'll see that's not going to be a
problem because despite this being much
looser than a traditional semifreddo
recipe we still have tens of thousands
of little tiny air bubbles which once
frozen is going to give this dessert
it's amazing ice cream like texture so
we'll go ahead and we'll stir that mix
that fold that until it just comes
together at which point you can transfer
that into literally anything to freeze
it so because I'm doing a mocha version
I'm going to freeze and serve mine in
some coffee cups and I'm just doing two
here but if you make a bigger batch you
can do this in a loaf pan and slice it
which is the church
no way to serve it so I transferred that
into my coffee cups and then by far the
hardest part of the recipe we got to
wrap these in plastic and let them
freeze completely overnight is best so
the exact time is going to be up to you
to decide
you are the Tom Petty of when these are
ready and yes the waiting is the hardest
part so I did leave mine overnight at
which point we can pull it out and see
what we got in case you're wondering
semifreddo means half cold or half
frozen which of everything's gone
according to plan is the exact texture
you should get so we shouldn't have
anything that's hard and brittle we
should have something that even though
frozen is still soft light and luxurious
almost literally half frozen so this was
just perfect but anyway let's go ahead
and garnish these up and all we're going
to use for that is just some very
lightly whipped cream to sort of
simulate some steamed milk and then once
we've garnished those with a little bit
of whipped cream we'll finish with a
dusting of cocoa and our mocha
semifreddo is done so let me grab a
spoon and head right in and despite
doing everything compared to the
traditional recipe completely wrong not
only do we have a beautiful deep coffee
flavor but the texture really is amazing
alright it's somewhere in between a very
light airy ice cream and maybe a sort of
dense frozen mousse I mean considering
how easy the recipe is and that it's not
churned in an ice cream machine as it
freezes I really think we've achieved a
remarkable mouthfeel but anyway that's
it mocha semifreddo I really do hope you
give this half frozen but fully
delicious Italian ice cream like dessert
a try soon so head over to food whooshes
calm for all the ingredient amounts and
more infos usual and as always enjoy
you
